name: Alluvial
description: Most widespread soil in India, found in Indo-Gangetic plains. Deposited by rivers over millennia. Extremely fertile and supports intensive agriculture. Divided into Khadar (new alluvium) and Bhangar (old alluvium).
recommended_fertilizers: Zinc Sulphate @ 25 kg/ha for zinc deficiency

name: Black (Regur)
description: Also called Black Cotton Soil or Regur. Formed from Deccan trap basaltic lava. Rich in clay minerals (montmorillonite) giving high water retention. Develops deep cracks in summer and swells when wet. Ideal for cotton cultivation.
recommended_fertilizers: Urea + Neem-coated Urea for slow N release
Single Super Phosphate (SSP) for P and S

name: Red
description: Formed by weathering of ancient crystalline and metamorphic rocks. Red color due to iron oxide. Found on Deccan Plateau eastern and southern parts. Generally poor in nutrients but responds well to fertilization and irrigation.
recommended_fertilizers: Lime application to correct acidity (2-4 tonnes/ha)
FYM @ 10-15 tonnes/ha to improve organic carbon

name: Laterite
description: Formed under tropical conditions with high temperature and heavy rainfall causing intense leaching. Rich in iron and aluminium oxides, poor in nitrogen, phosphorus, and calcium. Hardens when exposed to air (used as building blocks).
recommended_fertilizers: Heavy doses of FYM and compost (15-20 tonnes/ha)
Lime application to correct acidity (3-5 tonnes/ha)
Rock phosphate as slow-release P source
Green manuring to improve organic matter

name: Desert (Arid)
description: Found in arid and semi-arid regions of Rajasthan and parts of Gujarat, Haryana, Punjab. Sandy texture with poor water holding capacity. Rich in phosphorus and calcium but deficient in nitrogen and organic matter. Highly productive under irrigation.
recommended_fertilizers: Urea in split doses (avoid single large dose)
Drip irrigation for efficient water use

name: Forest (Mountain)
description: Found in hilly and mountainous regions with sufficient rainfall. Rich in humus and organic matter in upper layers but deficient in potassium and phosphorus. Acidic in nature due to heavy leaching. Supports plantation crops and temperate fruits.
recommended_fertilizers: Maintain organic matter through leaf litter recycling

name: Peaty (Marshy)
description: Found in areas of heavy rainfall and high humidity where waterlogging occurs. Very high organic matter content (humus). Acidic and often deficient in phosphorus and potassium. Found in deltas and coastal areas.
recommended_fertilizers: Lime application to correct severe acidity
Single Super Phosphate (SSP) for P and S
Raised bed cultivation for non-rice crops

name: Saline-Alkaline
description: Found in waterlogged and semi-arid regions. Contains excess soluble salts (saline) or high exchangeable sodium (alkaline/sodic). White salt efflorescence on surface (Reh/Usar). Requires reclamation for productive agriculture. Common in canal-irrigated areas.

characteristics.color: White salt crusts on grayish soil

suitable_crops: Salt-tolerant varieties of wheat and rice
recommended_fertilizers: Gypsum application @ 5-10 tonnes/ha for sodic soil reclamation
Green manuring with Dhaincha/Sesbania before rice
